skills.title: Wordpress
skills.desc: WordPress is web publishing software you can use to create a beautiful website or blog.

skills.title: PhotoShop
skills.desc: Adobe Photoshop is a raster graphics editor developed and published by Adobe for Windows and macOS.

skills.title: Html
skills.desc: HyperText Markup Language (HTML) is the standard markup language for documents designed to be displayed in a web browser.

skills.title: Css
skills.desc: Cascading Style Sheets (CSS) is a simple mechanism for adding style (e.g., fonts, colors, spacing) to Web documents.

skills.title: Scss/Sass
skills.desc: CSS with superpowers. Sass is the most mature, stable, and powerful professional grade CSS extension language in the world.

skills.title: Tailwind
skills.desc: Tailwind CSS is an open-source CSS framework. The main feature of this library is that, unlike other CSS frameworks like Bootstrap, it does not provide a series of predefined classes for elements such as buttons or tables.

skills.title: JavaScript
skills.desc: JavaScript (JS) is a lightweight interpreted (or just-in-time compiled) programming language with first-class functions.

skills.title: ReactJs
skills.desc: React is a free and open-source front-end JavaScript library for building user interfaces based on components. It is maintained by Meta and a community of individual developers and companies

skills.title: Github
skills.desc: GitHub is a developer platform that allows developers to create, store, manage and share their code. It uses Git software, providing the distributed version control of Git plus access control, bug tracking, software feature requests, task management, continuous integration, and wikis for every project.
